When a drunkard barged into a room where my friend and I had runin order to get away from him.We were all alone and all I couldsee was this hand coming towards me.
That someone would discover whom I really love.
Having a car accident.
Left alone in the dark in a big building.
Fearing the use of power or reprimands when I belong to theminority.

I was skiing with friends and they wanted to ski-jump. I did notwant to be left behind, so I braced myself and followed them.
When one meets new people with whom one is forced to collaboratewith.
When, as a child, I was nearly knocked down by a car.
When I walk through streets late at night. This is because I andmy friends were attacked one night without any reason for it.
One dark night with no street lights, a car was obviouslyfollowing me.
Facing a mad dog.
I was walking home with a friend at night along a quiet street. Something started rustling in the bush : it was an exhibitionist.
Almost crashing into the back of a car while driving along themotorway on my motorcycle.

Fear - paralysing - that I would not be accepted by the God who Ibelieved to be there because I was \morally bankrupt\" (beforebecoming a Christian and realising that that was why Christ came tofree us from sin and to forgive us)."
Staying alone in the biology building after the dark.

I caught a huge eel on a fishing line which I had pulled into theboat. I cut the line and threw the whole lot back into the water.Later that day and about ten miles away I went swimming andsomeone made the comment wondering how far eels could swim, Iabruptly ended swimming for fear at an unseen eel for a few daysuntil we had left the district.

It so happened that while staying at anaunt's place I discoveredthat I was afraid of sleeping in pitch darkness.The roomwhich my sister and I were sharing had no light, and I wouldrefuse to sleep without having the light of the adjoiningbathroom switched on.
When confronted and in my opinion hassled by the police.

One day a fierce looking man came to our houseand said that myfather should apologize to him, however I was alone at home.
When I woke up in the middle of the night because of a dream, itwasn't a nightmare, it was an uninteligible dream in wich I wokebecause of a certain end.
When I was dreaming that I was being chased, in the upmost ofhorror the door of the closed felt down synchronicaly with thedream scare.
I was attacked, standing in a doorway, by a pack of 5 dogs,alsatians and farm dogs with my escape route blocked by a shutfence.
I was alone walking in a deserted part of the city and I had somefear that some men would attack me and rob me.
My father was away from home and he did not come back when he wasexpected, he came back several hours later than expected.
When my mother was seriously ill and had to be admitted to thehospital.
Every time I imagine that someone I love or I could contact aserious illness, even death.
Falling off a cliff in the mountains.
An hour before receiving the certificate results I was veryfrightened.When I saw others crying I felt very tense and astime went by my fear grew.

When there was a fight at home and my father threatened to throwa chair on my brother.
Suddenly found out that I was the lasr one to leave the anatomyroom.
Staying alone in the room after midnight and reading horrorstories.
Staying alone in the dark.
Assaulted by drunken neighbour.

Fear of the turn that the examination paper would take as Ilacked confidence.
I was afraid when my dog ran out through a crack in the fencewhena train was coming.
I felt this feeling when one day my landlord's cat had creptunder my bed and I couldn't cope with it during an hour and ahalf.
When a man rang the doorbell and wanted to enter the house withviolence. I was alone at home that moment.

This situation keeps occurring - when my little sister disagreeswith me or vice-versa. We have very similar temperaments and Ialways end up feeling angry at her and myself for fighting somuch over unimportant trivial matters.
My boy-friend came home late one night without having told meabout it before.

My partner without discussing with me the situation decided itwas time for us to have a break and went ahead and arranged hisown life for the next 6-12 months, then told me the day before itwas about to happen having been tolerant and friendly for thepreceding week.
When my car suddenly broke down !
The mother of a person with whom we had been sharing a housingaccused me of trying to rip her off over payment of bills in thehouse.
When a car is overtaking another and I am forced to drive off theroad.
My parents did not let me go on holidays with my friends.

When I felt being treated unjustly by a teacher.
When I am discussing something with a person and I realize thatthe other person is thinking over her own argumentations insteadof listening, I become angry.
When I quarelled with my parents.
When my brother went out with my new shirt that I adored, andreturned it dirty with grease.
I got angry with a stranger in a train who behaved impertinentlyand immorally
Landlord putting up rents sneakly and slimily.

When playing a football match, there was one player who made meantackels, kicked at everything and did things having nothing to dowith football.
Discussion with my mother about the way to educate my children. Ifelt anger against my mother.
When I got the feeling that I had to do all the housekeepingwhile my boyfriend didn't do anything. This happened in a periodof exams when I had to study very hard.

I had a date with a friend to see a movie and my friend was late. I waited for a long hour and was very angry.
I was scolded by my mother for no reason.

Without the employer's knowledge and even without anycommunication their bank accounts were changed and their personalaccounts closed.
I was really angry when the President general of UNZASU wasarrested by policemen.

Arriving home from work after a long and tiring day to find nodinner prepared as I had expected.

In a discussion the leader wanted to stop because she was of theopinion that we were not involved and she misjudged our reactionsas negative. We however only posed several questions which shecouldn't answer.

I had an accident with a trafic police car that was packed at acurve without any visibility and against all traffic regulationsin a strong snowstorm. As a result I still cannot repair my carbecause of the missing spare parts.
When my colleague spat on my face after a quarrel.
When someone took my writing materials yet I was to writeExaminations in a few minutes.
After an exhausting day I came home and wanted to take a bath torelax. My father wanted to take a bath first and when he hadfinished after an hour, there was no hot water left for me.
A girl entered in the division where I work and greeted everybodybut not me.

My family told me to leave if I was not willing to accept theconditions they imposed on me.
There was a lot of irritation between me and a person who livesin the same house where I live. Suddenly it became too much for me and Iaccused him of several things.

The day the results of the Chinese university was announced Ishould have been very happy; however my grandmother, because of her prejudice and misunderstanding, started aquarrel with mymother.She expected me to take her side and she deliberatelytalked of my mother's wrong doings.I was very angry because -one my grandmother was not being reasonable and two because itshould have been a happy day and three we had moved into a newhouse that day.
As a child - about 8 years old - walking across a paddock - beingset upon by another boy who claimed it was \his land\" - being intimidated by the boy - crying, being punched, etc."
When a colleague was rude with me because she didn't understandthe subject about which I was discussing.
South Korea winning more gold medals in the Asian Olympic (morethan China).

One day, when riding on a bicycle path, a car coming from theopposite direction forced me to get off my bike although I hadthe priority.
When I got low marks in B.Sc final.
My parents do not like my friend and told me not to go out withhim.
Someone who always took care for the key of the sportshall stayedaway without letting us know. Next time he did as if nothing hadhappened.

Argument with roommate over a lock he had put on kitchen cupboardwithout telling anyone.

While studying chemistry with a friend we became angry witheachother because we were both fed up.

Being a spokesman for the union, I got into a quarrel with acolleague who had been acting disloyally over a sustained periodof time.
When a pick-pocket robbed me of my money (K20) while Iwasbuying bathing soap.
My life-partner, who was drinking more and more, spoke aboutkicking the cat.He had never done anything of the kind, but Iknew that he would do so one day, without thinking about it.

I felt much anger and perhaps I feel it till now, against mygirlfriend's sister who incited her to betray me just when Ineeded her very much. She didn't think of anything, simplypassed over everything.

Anger at doctors for their treatment of me after giving birth.They left part of placenta behind and I bled heavily for twelveweeks - due to this, I felt weak and emotional, and they said Ineeded psychiatric treatment and give me no support.
I took part in a football match. The referee was extremelypartial to the opposite team. This stirred up my discontent andanger.
A friend was unpunctual, we wanted to prepare ourselves for anexamination.
I was told to do something I did not want to do.
[ I feel angry when somebody is unjust to me.]
When a discussion resulted in an insult, which in my opinion, wasnot justified.
I felt angry when my mother-in-law did not handle my daughterproperly and she fell down from the bed and hurt her head.

I had made an appointment with three friends. We had to go outtogether. When I arrived at the place, the other persons weren'tthere. I became very angry because I thought they were gonewithout me. That, however, didn't appear to be the case.
When my brother was held up and robbed.
My class leader told me I am not chosen for your Englishlectures.
When my friend (girl) promised to help me go to the hospital and beexamined by good experts and she deceived me.

I feel this feeling when I am to fill in a questionnaire or aform.
At boarding school someone put a lot of tiny thorns on my bed. When I complained everybody began teasing me and laughing at myinability to find out my enemies.I lost my temper.

A friend of mine tried to persuade me to go at her place to actas a model because she felt too tired. She said that I onlywas talking about looking for work, but if it was possible Iwould not accept it. I was angry about this unjust judgment.

Two boys whom I know were telling me, in an indecent manner, howthey had teased a young and shy girl I know.They had despisedher conviction, scorned and touched her.I got very angry anddid not try to conceal it and gave it back to them.

I had applied for a job and they had assured me that the examswould take place a few months later.A week later I went toobtain some more information and they told me that the exams hadalready taken place.
I felt angry at one time when I was chatting with friends andsuddenly another friend joined us and started opposing anycomment I added to our chatting.
My friends promised me that they would definitely call me to tellme if they were visiting me or not.
I live with my sister now and sometimes she angers me especiallywhen she thinks I don't keep the apt. clean enough.

The comrade staying next doors insulted me for what he called the misuse of his iron.He called me stupid, self centered etc. I wanted to punch him but instead went for a walk to the miningschool to cool off.
When I discovered that my girlfriend was going around withanother boy.
When my sister took my things without having asked for my permissionfirst.
In the student kitchen that we share, somebody drank from myjuice pot (one litre) so that I only got one glass out of thewhole pot.
I reached the bus stop and realized that I had forgotten my buspass.

A female classmate was always late for meetings which were forthe homework and not social gatherings.We were very busy andthe deadline was close but we had to waste half an hour or anhour waiting for her as we could do nothing else then.
I was annoyed this particular day as it seemad that the odds werenot in my favour.My grandfather added fuel to the fire, when I had an important appointment so I unleashed my anger on him.
I wrote an assignment and was given less marks than a friend withwhom I had previously discussed the assignment.

I was not given a chance to explain to my close relatives as towhy I could not go to visit them when they were ill.When I didgo, they thought that I had been selfish and irresponsible during their illness.
When someone lies to me.

We hitch hiked our way back from a town rather drunk.We weredropped in another town which was unknown to us.I needed tourinate, so I did it on a wall which turned out to belong to themilitary headquarters.They arrested me and made me pay a fineof 500 pts.We had to go home on foot (6 km) since it was toolate for anyone to give us a lift.

A friend visited and made comments that my house/garden were notas neat/tidy as in the past. I'd not seen her a year - Sheimplied I'd gone to the pack (I'd only been working full time,and taking 3 University exams part time).
At an unjust, or to be more precise, at a bureaucratic treatmentof one's personality.
I was angry when somebody stole my half petticoat.
Listening to long speech of the party leaders wasting my time.
When we rearranged furniture in our flat and got stuck in achair.
Physical violence. A friend wouldn't listen to me I repeatedlytried to warn him, to no avail. Result: eight people were \pissedoff\"."
When I found out that my sister had been playing with myconfidential things which she had taken from my hand-bag.

In a sociology class I felt very angry towards some members ofsociety for exploiting the Polynesian people, dawn raids byPolice (Martin Luther King, Blacks in S.A.). But this was just areflection of my own shortcomings.
It was quite recently, at the football match between the nationalteams of Bulgaria and France. I felt strong anger with the Scottishreferee who ran the match quite partially.

Uncleaniness at my work place.The place is generally not veryclean, but when it reaches a point, I get angry at the personwho is supposed to clean the place and the people who aresupposed to supervise him.
At an office an application that I had made was turned downbecause of a scrupulous interpretation of the rules.
When I was accused of something I had not done.

I felt angry when repeated pleas to the ticket collector and theco-passengers in order to make a queue fell on deaf ears.I havethis feeling whenever someone is not disciplined and methodic indoing his duty.
A certain friend tried to push me off a seat in a very violentway for no apparent reason.It may be that he was excited aboutsomething.
The juniors in our dormitory at school started to complain andmake a lot of noise about the duties assigned to them by theprefect who was my class-mate and was very cool and dull.
Discussing with a certain person about a job I was getting andthat perosn was negative and pessimistic.
When I was accused of having planned my friend's outing atsecondary school (boarding) as we were not allowed to go out.
A murder.
I was the compere at a party and all my efforts to get the showrolling were thwarted by the immobile, non co-operative guests. I felt frustation - bordering on anger.
My girl-friend did not understand me; I was angry with myselfbecause I had problems when we seperated - I could not resignmyself to it.
My mother in law slept in my bed.
Having my personal objects rearranged by someone else without myconsent and having it arranged to their taste. Then trying tofind a particular object they rearranged for an hour or more.
I felt unfairly treated at an airport, being told to use adifferent counter (for domestic traffic only).
When I saw a man hitting a child of 2 years without any consideration,simply because the child had been leaning against a window.
When I was blamed for some of my attributes which are very oftenmisunderstood, especially when one is very frank.

My friend half-teasingly called me a bad nickname.I feltinsulted and kicked his hip in anger.I was stable later and didnot feel angry at him.In fact I was afraid that the otherfriends who were with us would think that I was an intolerantperson.However I could not apologize, so I pretended thatnothing had happened and smiled when I left.My friend did notsay anything but just watched me leave.

My classmate used her personal relations to get a seat for asubject that I wanted also.I had taken the pains to help himapply and I did not get selected.I did not like this as he hadnot told me the facts earlier, he need not have lied to me.

Because I am the Captain of a basketball team I usually organisea roster system so that everyone in the team can have a turn atdoing either a duty or a ref. A lot of the time the girls can'tbe bothered or just forget - I usually have to fill in.
During a lecture, a colleague who did not know anything about thesubject, got on my nerves asking silly questions.
I felt it when a girl who was dear to me lied to my face. I gotangry with the fact that she knew I didn't believe her but shekept on telling lies.
I had worked very hard during my vacations to raise some moneyfor a few major items (e.g a radio).but when I arrived at theinter-city bus terminal, my hard earned money had been stolenfrom me.
My mother told me that I could not go to the mountains.Despitemy age, as long as I am in her house I must do what she says.
When my mother slapped me in the face, I felt anger at thatmoment.

A nuisance used to live in our flat a month ago. I experiencedthis feeling when I tried to chase her out.
An old lady slipped and nobody helped her.
I have a friend that I deeply trusted but it happened that I lostmy confidence in her for which she herself was to blame.
When a very close friend with whom I have a very intimate andbodily relationship (he had a girlfriend) started to avoid me anddidn't want to talk to me any more.
I wanted to borrow lecture notes from a friend and he did notlend me them.

At having an argument with a stranger, in the street.

A person ignored my advice, did not pay any attention to what wassaying. She acted as though I wasn't even there. We were doinggroup work so everybody had the right to speak yet she justignored me. She made me feel insignificant.
A friend of mine had promised to arrange me some tickets for aconcert which I considered important.He could not get them theway he thought he would, so he gave up the whole thing.
I had a quarrel with my parents; I was convinced to be right.
When I see how people around me pass by certain unjustice becauseof indifference or cowardice.

With self at losing an important game that I should have won.
Never really had the experience just yet - N/A.

I feel angry at people's indifference at our ability to bepresent at an event and to stay partial to what happens.

Most recently when the chairman at the New Zeeland Rugby Unionannounced that the All Blacks' would accept the invitation ofSouth Africa to play rugby in that country.
My cousins were playing at home and one of them broke a decorativeobject which was very precious to me.
One of my friends went and told another friend of mine that I wasgoing abut with another guy in Lilongwe besides the one I had.She said I was seen with him hand in hand.
I was angry when someone stole a magazine which I had borrowedfrom another friend and locked it in a drawer.
When I did not find the rack used for beating up rugs, in theyard.
A friend doesn't let me study when I want to. She doesn't feel Ineed to study and doesn't understand how important studying is tome. I get very angry with her.
About the car (sadness) I felt anger the way I acted afternegotiating it.
People not resprcting my opinion.

When our government decided to withdraw student allowances as itwas one of the conditions imposed by the IMF.

When my girlfriend of two years told me it was all over.
As I usually do not start learning until a short time before anexamination,, I once made up my mind to try to work for a longertime. But once again I did not do it - and got a bad mark.

About a month ago the Regional Council refused to pay my wife thedue maternity benefit, because of bureaucratic reasons.
A classmate damaged ma iron and tried to hide the damage.

When one teacher unjustly gave me zero in a test saying that Iwas cribbing.
When boyfriend lied to me.
After having quarelled with a relative of mine about politics.

When people harrass me I feel oppressed by their behavior.
While still at school a friend died of cancer, after being illfor a long time, she was 17 yrs old.
When my grandmother died.
I had drunk a couple of beers and my fiancee got angry at me.
Enrolling at varsity, being told I couldn't get in to certainpapers.
I was very sad when I had to leave persons with whom I had a veryintense relationship I also had to leave the environment whichwas part of this.
When my mother was very sick and almost died.
I suffer form a disease of my muscles. However, I cannot talkabout it and my feelings, the consequence with my parents. Theytry to repress it.
When I see people with burns I feel sad, actually I can not evenexpress my feelings as I think that they must suffer a lot.

One night my father suddenly suffered from a heart attack whichlead to breathing difficulties.

My teacher's death.
When I am with a friend and we have to leave each other.
I was sad at the expulsion of some of my comrades during the UNZAdemonstrations.

This sounds really predictable and usual but it was absolutelyheart-rending at the time. My first lover (I was 15) just rang upone day and announced that he had found another woman. I neversaw him again and it hurt because I was positive that it was\TRUE LOVE\" !!"
When I was not chosen to go to your English lectures.
When my mother was proved to suffer from a very serious disease.
When I was at school.
My good friend misunderstood me.

My grandmother died.

At the death of my husband's father's mother which occurredduring university examinations and therefore I was unable toattend her funeral.

Losing close people and animals. So far, I've felt most whenlosing our dog in a traffic accident.
When my uncle died I saw a funeral for the first time. All peoplestood around the open grave and cried.
When the girl whom I have lusted after expressed reciprocalfeelings and then days later changed her mind.
Recently I happened to remain alone for a long time.
My mother was working with a knife and we were all laughingheartily.She was not able to control the knife and stuck itdeep into her hand.
